sen.j: 勧修（かんしゅう、天慶8年（945年）? - 寛弘5年7月8日 (旧暦)（1008年8月11日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Kanshu (945?-August 17, 1008) was a priest of Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「寛弘5年7月8日 (旧暦)」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1008年8月17日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Kanshu (945-August 17, 1008) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: made "Sect" lowercase for consistency with other articles; fixed grammar
sen.e: Kanshu (945-August 17, 1008) was a priest of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His secular surname was that of the Shiki clan.
His secular surname was of the Shiki clan.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: His secular surname was of the Shiki clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 11歳の時比叡山に上って稚児となり、その後出家して、寛和元年（985年）に余慶から灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: He entered Hiei-zan Mountain and became a Chigo (child in a Buddhist possession) at the age of 11, and afterward he became a priest and received the teachings of Buddhism from Yokei.
Kanshu entered the temple on Mt. Hiei-zan and became a Chigo (child in Buddhist possession) at the age of 11, afterwards becoming a priest and receiving the teachings of Buddhism from Yokei.
sen.cmt: added "temple" before "Mt. Hiei-zan" for clarity; changed "Hiei-zan Mountain" to "Mt. Hiei-zan" to reduce wordiness
sen.e: Kanshu entered the temple on Mt. Hiei and became a Chigo (child in Buddhist possession) at the age of 11, afterwards becoming a priest and receiving the kanjo (initiation of a succession where water is poured onto the successor's head) from Yokei in 985.
sen.cmt: Mt. Hiei-zan を Mt. Hiei に修正しました。灌頂を受けたthe teachings of Buddhism をthe kanjo (initiation of a succession where water is poured onto the successor's head) に修正しました。寛和元年（985年）に訳漏れのため、文末に in 985 を追記しました。

sen.j: また勢祐からも学んでいる。
sen.e: He also learned from Seiyu.
Kanshu studied under Seiyu as well.
sen.cmt: lengthened slightly to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: Kanshu studied under Seiyu as well.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 長徳3年（997年）には、中国の北宋から送られてきた天台宗に関する書物について師である実因とともに批判している。
sen.e: In 997, he, together with his teacher Jitsuin, criticized a book on Tendai Sect which was sent from Baisong, China.
sen.cmt: 「実因」＝「Jitsuin」か、下記サイトから引用しました。http://hukumusume.com/douwa/i/new/11/09.htm
sen.e: In 997, together with his teacher Jitsuin, he criticized a book on the Tendai sect which was sent from Baisong, China.
sen.cmt: fixed comma placement and grammar
sen.e: In 997, together with his teacher Jitsuin, he criticized a book on the Tendai sect which was sent from Baisong, China.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年に園城寺長吏となり、長保2年（1000年）8月には大僧正に任じられている。
sen.e: In that year, he became Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple and in September 1000 was appointed Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order).
sen.cmt: 「長保2年（1000年）8月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1000年9月7日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Later that year, he became the Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple, and in September 1000 he was appionted as a Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Later that year, he became the Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple, and in September 1000 he was appionted as a Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寛弘2年（1005年）、藤原道長が宇治に浄妙寺を建立した際にはその開山となった。
sen.e: When FUJIWARA no Michinaga raised Jomyo-ji Temple in Uji in 1005, he became the Kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest).
When FUJIWARA no Michinaga erected the Jomyo-ji Temple in Uji in 1005, Kanshu became the Kaisan (the founder of a temple as the first chief priest).
sen.cmt: 建立: "raised"→"erected'; Changed "he" to "Kanshu" because the meaning was ambiguous (assuming that Kanshu is the subject here…)
sen.e: When FUJIWARA no Michinaga erected the Jomyo-ji Temple in Uji in 1005, Kanshu became the Kaisan (the founder of a temple as the first chief priest).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 没後の寛仁3年（1019年）12月に智静の諡号が贈られた。
sen.e: After his death, he was given Shigo (a posthumous name), Chisei in January 1020.
sen.cmt: 「寛仁3年（1019年）12月」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1020年1月4日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: After his death, he was given the posthumous name Shigo in January 1020.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally, eliminating content in parenthesis
sen.e: After his death, he was given the posthumous name (Shigo) "Chisei" in January 1020.
sen.cmt: OK
